value.description: Standard pattern Astartes power armour in the livery of the I Legion, the Dark Angels. Power armour worn by the Legiones Astartes is a sophisticated defensive system, combining huge resistance to physical damage along with integrated electro-motivated fibre bundles which augment the strength of the wearer.\n\nThe Dark Angels were the first of the Emperor's Space Marine Legions, and in their earliest incarnation they fought as the personal army of the Master of Mankind. Unyielding, technologically capable, ruthless and insular, the Dark Angels at the time of the Heresy were a powerful and highly-independent Legion.

Standard pattern Astartes power armour helmet in the livery of the I Legion, the Dark Angels. Completing a set of power armour, the helmet seals the wearer in a closed environment allowing for combat in the most extreme atmospheres. It also incorporates advanced targeting and sensory systems.\n\nThe Dark Angels were the first of the Emperor's Space Marine Legions, and in their earliest incarnation they fought as the personal army of the Master of Mankind. Unyielding, technologically capable, ruthless and insular, the Dark Angels at the time of the Heresy were a powerful and highly-independent Legion.

Assault pattern Astartes power armour in the livery of the I Legion, the Dark Angels. This armour incorporates a light and effective jump pack, allowing the wearer to quickly engage enemies across the battlefield.\n\nThe Dark Angels were the first of the Emperor's Space Marine Legions, and in their earliest incarnation they fought as the personal army of the Master of Mankind. Unyielding, technologically capable, ruthless and insular, the Dark Angels at the time of the Heresy were a powerful and highly-independent Legion.

Cataphractii pattern tactical dreadnought Armour in the livery of the I Legion, the Dark Angels. Commonly called terminator armour, this armour is an advanced form of powered armour developed by blending dreadnought sarcophagi, standard power armour, and the heavy suits used by engineers working in the most hostile environments. The result is a level of protection far superior to power armour; but also an immense mass, causing a reduction in manoeuvrability and speed.\n\nThe Dark Angels were the first of the Emperor's Space Marine Legions, and in their earliest incarnation they fought as the personal army of the Master of Mankind. Unyielding, technologically capable, ruthless and insular, the Dark Angels at the time of the Heresy were a powerful and highly-independent Legion.

Astartes tactical dreadnought armour helmet in the livery of the I Legion, the Dark Angels. Completing a set of terminator armour, this helmet fully encloses the wearer and provides life-support functions, along with an array of sensors more advanced than those of standard power armour.\n\nThe Dark Angels were the first of the Emperor's Space Marine Legions, and in their earliest incarnation they fought as the personal army of the Master of Mankind. Unyielding, technologically capable, ruthless and insular, the Dark Angels at the time of the Heresy were a powerful and highly-independent Legion.

Crafted in homage to the armour of Caliban and the heritage of his new Legion, the Leonine Panoply was both a brutally efficient aegis against harm and a fitting set of regalia for the First of the Primarchs.\n\nLion El'Jonson, Primarch of the I Legion, the Dark Angels, was regarded as the most pragmatic and ruthlessly efficient commander of the Great Crusade. His was the task of rooting out those threats which the Imperium most feared, and he undertook it with peerless valour.

The crowning glory of the Leonine Panoply, the Lion Helm was a graceful ceramite helm that bore a set of plumed wings in the style of the First Legion's emblem, and which incorporated a power field projector of ancient design.\n\nLion El'Jonson, Primarch of the I Legion, the Dark Angels, was regarded as the most pragmatic and ruthlessly efficient commander of the Great Crusade. His was the task of rooting out those threats which the Imperium most feared, and he undertook it with peerless valour.
